meanings.definition: A person who is the same age as another.
meanings.sent1: My agemate and I were born in the same year.
meanings.sent2: I have known my agemate since we were both five years old.
meanings.sent3: My agemate and I always get mistaken for siblings because we look so similar.
meanings.sent4: Growing up with an agemate can feel like having a built-in best friend.
meanings.sent5: Being an agemate with someone can create a special bond that lasts a lifetime.

meanings.definition: To be of the same age as someone else.
meanings.sent1: I agemate with my cousin, as we were both born in the same month.
meanings.sent2: It is rare to agemate with someone who was born on the exact same day as you.
meanings.sent3: We agemate so closely that people often mistake us for twins.
meanings.sent4: In a small town, it is common for children to agemate with many of their classmates.
meanings.sent5: To agemate with someone can lead to shared experiences and understanding.
